citations.narrative:
The water buckets in several enclosures (“Jacob sheep pen”, “Angora goats pen”, and “Alpaca pen”) were noted to be
dirty and had a dried dark colored residue on the sides above the water line plus dirt/particulate material on the bottom of
the buckets.
Per this Section, all water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. Dirty water receptacles can affect the quality and
palatability of the water, and the animals may decrease their intake of water. Correct by 3/18/24.

The shed in the Pot belly pig enclosure needed to be cleaned. The floor of the shed had an accumulation of fecal matter
present on the surface of the floor adjacent to the walls that was several inches deep and there was an unpleasant odor.
Per this Section of the Regulations, excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to minimize
disease hazards, to reduce odors, and prevent contamination of the animals. The shed in the pot belly pig enclosure
needs to be cleaned more frequently for the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by 3/18/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
